qas.question: Where was the planned invasion of Britain by France?

answers.text: near the mouth of the Loire

qas.question: How did the French plan to transport their troops to Britain for the invasion?
What happened to the French Mediterranean fleet?

answers.text: the Mediterranean fleet under Jean-François de La Clue-Sabran was scattered by a larger British fleet

qas.question: What happened to the French Brest fleet?

answers.text: caught the French Brest fleet with 21 ships of the line under Marshal de Conflans and sank, captured, or forced many of them aground

qas.question: With the loss of the two fleets, how did the French get their troops to Britain for the invasion?

answers.text: putting an end to the French plans.

context: The French planned to invade the British Isles during 1759 by accumulating troops <a0_0>near the mouth of the Loire<a0_0/> and concentrating <a1_0>their Brest and Toulon fleets<a1_0/>. However, two sea defeats prevented this. In August, <a2_0>the Mediterranean fleet under Jean-François de La Clue-Sabran was scattered by a larger British fleet<a2_0/> under Edward Boscawen at the Battle of Lagos. In the Battle of Quiberon Bay on 20 November, the British admiral Edward Hawke with 23 ships of the line <a3_0>caught the French Brest fleet with 21 ships of the line under Marshal de Conflans and sank, captured, or forced many of them aground<a3_0/>, <a4_0>putting an end to the French plans.
